de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.algorithms.superimposition

Class VectorSuperimposer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.bioforscher.singa.mathematics.algorithms.superimposition.VectorSuperimposer

  • public class VectorSuperimposer
extends java.lang.Object
    An implementation of the Kabsch algorithm that uses Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) to compute the ideal superimposition of two point sets (a list of Vectors).
    See Also:
    Wikipedia: Kabsch algorithm

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static VectorSuperimposition calculateIdealVectorSuperimposition(java.util.List<Vector> reference, java.util.List<Vector> candidate) 
      static VectorSuperimposition calculateKuhnMunkresSuperimposition(java.util.List<Vector> reference, java.util.List<Vector> candidate)
      Finds the superimposition with the minimal distances between pairs of Vectors by using KuhnMunkres optimization.
      static VectorSuperimposition calculateVectorSuperimposition(java.util.List<Vector> reference, java.util.List<Vector> candidate)

      • calculateKuhnMunkresSuperimposition

        public static VectorSuperimposition calculateKuhnMunkresSuperimposition(java.util.List<Vector> reference,
                                                                        java.util.List<Vector> candidate)
        Finds the superimposition with the minimal distances between pairs of Vectors by using KuhnMunkres optimization. This is only useful if candidate and reference vectors are already pre-aligned.
        Parameters:
        reference - The reference Vectors to which should be aligned.
        candidate - The candidate Vectors for the alignment should be carried out.
        Returns:
        The VectorSuperimposition with the minimal distances between pairs.
